note.p: Army officer. Served in the Royal Artillery. Gentleman cadet, 1847; captain, 1867, major, 1872, lieutenant-colonel, 1877, major-general, 1893. From 1882 on half pay as inspector and purchaser of horses; moved to the Remount Establishment in 1891. Retired in 1894. Originator of the Horse Registration Scheme and the Remount Department.
Census returns of England and Wales 1881 (The National Archives: Public Record Office RG11/49/27/48)
Wiltshire, England, Church of England births and baptisms, 1813–1916 (Ancestry.com, accessed 10 January 2018)
